title: FS: COMPLETE t213-3 set ~ 70 cards all SGC graded ~ NOW INDIVIDUAL CARDS FOR SALE
author: trobba

posts.post_title: FS: COMPLETE t213-3 set ~ 70 cards all SGC graded ~ NOW INDIVIDUAL CARDS FOR SALE
posts.post_content:
Would like to sell as complete set, before considering breaking it up.
Average grade roughly SGC 50
4 overprints

some highlights:

Cobb red portrait SGC 30
Cobb bat off SGC 50 overprint
Mathewson SGC 50 overprint (1/1 I believe)
Johnson SGC 60
Speaker SGC 40
Evers SGC 80
Chance port SGC 84

Happy to send scans as needed, and send complete list of cards/grades SERIOUS inquiries only please ... price ~ 225K

Substantial asking price, can provide references.

Thanks ~ Rob
Wow is right.  Good luck Rob.  This is an absolute beast (especially with the Fact 8 overprints)
This is one of the coolest listings I’ve ever seen on the site. Good luck with the sale!

I've decided to break the set up. I can send a list of the cards/grades to those interested in any players.

If you have an interest in a specific card please just send me a note and I can send you the particulars.

Preference will be given to those looking for multiple cards ... thanks ~ Rob

this rivals when I had 134 Cobbs , with 8 JAx CJ's and 8 CObb CJ's ,this is nearly unfathomable, great job in collecting,really !!! Sadly for me, 1 financial booboo and I would have tried to afford this. SO great !

Wanted to give a shout out to Rob.  After inquiring about the Crawford as part of his T213-3 set he also alluded that he had a slightly lower grade option for me.  We worked a deal out on that card, and now I am going to be hunting for a Type 1 Crawford to complete the run for T213.  

Thanks Rob for a great transaction and a nice addition to my collection!

Have to also drop a huge thank you to Rob here. Asked about available Senators, he worked with me to get the Type 3 he had and was super cool about modifying the translation when I realized that guys had changed teams between Type 2 and Type 3. 

I may not be ready to pull the trigger on the WaJo but if no one else does I’m in line for it! 

[quote name="Golfcollector" post=2476073]Wanted to give a shout out to Rob.  After inquiring about the Crawford as part of his T213-3 set he also alluded that he had a slightly lower grade option for me.  We worked a deal out on that card, and now I am going to be hunting for a Type 1 Crawford to complete the run for T213.  

Thanks Rob for a great transaction and a nice addition to my collection![/QUOTE]

Throwing this group back out there...have sold several cards but many in the set remain. 
If interested in any specific player just shoot me a note.

I will start to put some pricing on individual cards to try and help move things along if need be.

Thanks ~ Rob

How do you value the T-213 Cobb overprint?
Not many examples.
I purchased a T-213 Cobb back in 1997/1998 because I liked the card.
The card is a factory 8 overprint variation, at the time I did not know the factory overprint was a variation and a rare card.

Interested in lower grade Baltimore and Brooklyn—Bender Baltimore poses and Rucker and Wheat Brooklyn, primarily but open to others. Thanks 


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Interested in what you have left, sent a PM.

Rob is great! When he decided to break up the group, I was able to get several cards for my Baltimore and Brooklyn collections. Thanks so much!!!


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

Putting this back out there,
Plenty of cards remain ... thanks ~ Rob

Have sold some of this set, but many still remain.
Shoot me a note if interested in any players ... Thanks!
